[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Byzantine attack] [Timing attack] Can a Byzantine validator manipulate message timing to cause timeout-based attacks or prevent quorum formation? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Byzantine attack] [Batch poisoning] Can a Byzantine validator send invalid batches via BatchMsg that cause honest validators to fail execution? (Critical)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Byzantine attack] [Proof forgery] Can a Byzantine validator forge ProofOfStoreMsg signatures to claim batches are certified when they are not? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Byzantine attack] [Vote manipulation] Can a Byzantine validator send VoteMsg to different subsets of validators to create voting inconsistencies? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Byzantine attack] [Commit confusion] Can a Byzantine validator send conflicting CommitVoteMsg or CommitDecisionMsg to cause execution result disagreements? (Critical)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Concurrency] [Send race] Can concurrent calls to send_to() or send_to_many() cause message reordering that violates consensus ordering requirements? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Concurrency] [RPC race] Can concurrent send_rpc() calls to the same peer cause response confusion or lost responses? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Concurrency] [Clone race] Can cloning ConsensusNetworkClient while network operations are in progress cause inconsistent network state? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Concurrency] [Protocol race] Can concurrent protocol negotiation in to_bytes_by_protocol() cause different peers to use different protocols for the same message? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Concurrency] [Latency race] Can concurrent modifications to latency metrics via sort_peers_by_latency() cause incorrect peer ordering? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Error handling] [Silent failures] Can network send failures in send_to() or send_to_many() be silently ignored, causing consensus messages to be lost? (High)

[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Error handling] [RPC timeout] What happens if send_rpc() times out during critical consensus operations - can this cause safety or liveness violations? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Error handling] [Deserialization error] Can deserialization errors in received messages cause the validator to crash or enter an invalid state? (High)

[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Error handling] [Protocol fallback] If all preferred protocols fail, does the system have safe fallback behavior or can it enter a non-functional state? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Edge case] [Empty message] Can sending empty or zero-length ConsensusMsg cause unexpected behavior in message handling? (Low)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Edge case] [Self-send] What happens if a validator sends ConsensusMsg to itself - can this cause unexpected consensus state changes? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Edge case] [Invalid peer] How does send_to() handle sending to non-existent or offline peers - can this block consensus progress? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Edge case] [Maximum peers] Is there a limit on peer list size in send_to_many(), or can extremely large peer lists cause performance degradation? (Low)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [ProposalMsg attack] Can a malicious validator send ProposalMsg with valid format but invalid block data to cause execution failures? (Critical)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [ProposalMsg attack] Can ProposalMsg be sent for future rounds to cause premature round advancement and consensus disruption? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [VoteMsg attack] Can VoteMsg be crafted with correct signatures but incorrect vote data to bypass vote validation? (Critical)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [VoteMsg attack] Can delayed VoteMsg from previous rounds be replayed to affect current round voting? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [SyncInfo attack] Can SyncInfo messages with incorrect highest committed round cause validators to sync to wrong chain state? (Critical)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [SyncInfo attack] Can SyncInfo be used to trigger unnecessary synchronization operations, degrading performance? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [BlockRetrievalRequest attack] Can BlockRetrievalRequest be used to retrieve arbitrary historical blocks, enabling state reconstruction attacks? (Medium)
